actions.in_committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Health and the Environment.

official_title: A bill to amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to provide that the label and advertising of certain alcoholic beverages contain a statement warning consumers of possible health hazards associated with consumption of the beverage, unless such a requirement is in effect under other Federal law.

summary.text: Alcoholic Beverage Labeling Act Amendment - Amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to require a beverage consisting of more than 24 percent alcohol by volume to have specified health and legal purchase age warnings on its label or in its advertising. States that such requirement: (1) shall not preclude any additional State requirements; and (2) shall not apply to a beverage if other comparable Federal law is in effect.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to provide that the label and advertising of certain alcoholic beverages contain a statement warning consumers of possible health hazards associated with consumption of the beverage, unless such a requirement is in effect under other Federal law.
